description: There is mounting pressure to have two of France's best-loved poets reinterred in the Paris Pantheon.
title: Rimbaud and Verlaine: France agonises over digging up gay poets
title_page: Rimbaud and Verlaine: France agonises over digging up gay poets - BBC News
maintext: Rimbaud and Verlaine are certainly among the most revered of French poets - and it is also true that of the 75 residents of the Pantheon, none is there for poetry. Victor Hugo was transferred for his political achievement.
